# Inheritance Act Claim - Particulars of Claim Template

## Document Information

- **Template Version**: 1.0
- **Last Updated**: 2025-11-16
- **Purpose**: Template for Particulars of Claim in Inheritance Act 1975 applications
- **Related Legislation**: [Inheritance (Provision for Family and Dependants) Act 1975](../../references/legislation/statute-inheritance-act-1975.pdf)

## Instructions for Use

1. Replace all text in `[SQUARE BRACKETS]` with case-specific information
2. Delete optional sections not applicable to your case
3. Ensure all factual allegations are supported by evidence
4. Review CPR Part 16 and Practice Direction 57AC requirements
5. Have the document reviewed before filing

---

## IN THE [COUNTY COURT AT / HIGH COURT OF JUSTICE]

## [CHANCERY DIVISION / FAMILY DIVISION]

## CLAIM NO: [Insert when issued]

## BETWEEN:

### [CLAIMANT NAME]

**Claimant**

### -and-

### (1) [EXECUTOR NAME]

### (2) [BENEFICIARY NAME]

### [(3) [OTHER INTERESTED PARTY]]

**Defendants**

---

## PARTICULARS OF CLAIM

### 1. The Parties

1.1 The Claimant is [describe claimant's relationship to deceased, e.g., "the adult daughter of
the late [DECEASED NAME]"].

1.2 The First Defendant is [one of] the executor[s] of the Will dated [DATE] of [DECEASED NAME]
deceased ("the Deceased") and was appointed by [grant of probate / letters of administration]
on [DATE].

1.3 The Second Defendant is a beneficiary under the said Will [or: under the intestacy rules].

[Optional: 1.4 The Third Defendant is [describe interest in estate].]

### 2. The Deceased

2.1 The Deceased died on [DATE] aged [AGE] years.

2.2 The Deceased left a Will dated [DATE] ("the Will") [or: The Deceased died intestate].

2.3 [Grant of probate / Letters of administration] was/were granted to the First Defendant
on [DATE].

### 3. The Estate

3.1 The net value of the Deceased's estate is approximately £[AMOUNT].

3.2 The estate comprises:
   (a) [Property address], valued at approximately £[AMOUNT]
   (b) [Investments/savings], valued at approximately £[AMOUNT]
   (c) [Other assets]

3.3 Under the Will [or: intestacy rules], the estate is to be distributed as follows:
   [Set out distribution]

### 4. The Claimant's Status as Applicant

4.1 The Claimant is entitled to apply for an order under the Inheritance (Provision for Family
and Dependants) Act 1975 ("the 1975 Act") as [state category under s.1(1)]:

   [Choose applicable category:]
   - [the spouse / civil partner of the Deceased]
   - [a former spouse / civil partner of the Deceased who has not remarried / formed a civil partnership]
   - [a child of the Deceased]
   - [a person treated by the Deceased as a child of the family]
   - [a person who was being maintained by the Deceased immediately before death]
   - [a person who cohabited with the Deceased for at least 2 years before death]

### 5. The Claimant's Financial Position

5.1 The Claimant's current financial position is as follows:

**Income:**
   - [Employment income / benefits / pensions]: £[AMOUNT] per [month/year]
   - [Other income]: £[AMOUNT] per [month/year]

**Outgoings:**
   - [Housing costs]: £[AMOUNT] per month
   - [Living expenses]: £[AMOUNT] per month
   - [Other outgoings]: £[AMOUNT] per month

**Assets:**
   - [Property / savings / investments]: £[AMOUNT]
   - [Other assets]

**Liabilities:**
   - [Debts / mortgages]: £[AMOUNT]

### 6. The Claimant's Needs

6.1 The Claimant's current and foreseeable needs are:
   [Set out housing needs, income needs, special needs, etc.]

6.2 [Optional: The Claimant suffers from [medical condition / disability] which requires
[treatment / care / accommodation].]

### 7. Failure to Make Reasonable Financial Provision

7.1 The Will [or: intestacy] makes no provision [or: inadequate provision] for the Claimant.

7.2 Having regard to the matters set out in section 3 of the 1975 Act, the disposition of the
Deceased's estate fails to make reasonable financial provision for the Claimant because:
   [Set out reasons why provision is unreasonable]

### 8. Section 3 Matters

8.1 The Court is required by section 3 of the 1975 Act to have regard to the following matters:

**Financial resources and needs:**
   - The Claimant's resources and needs are set out above
   - [The Defendants' resources and needs are believed to be ...]

**Obligations and responsibilities:**
   - [Set out any obligations the Deceased had toward the Claimant]
   - [Set out current obligations toward beneficiaries]

**Size and nature of estate:**
   - As set out in paragraph 3 above

**Physical or mental disability:**
   - [Set out any relevant disabilities of parties]

**Other matters:**
   - [Any other relevant circumstances]

[For spouse/civil partner only:]

8.2 In the case of an application by a spouse or civil partner, the Court must also have regard
to the age of the applicant and the duration of the marriage/civil partnership, and the
contribution made by the applicant to the welfare of the family.

### 9. Relief Sought

9.1 The Claimant seeks an order under section 2 of the 1975 Act that reasonable financial
provision be made for the Claimant out of the Deceased's estate.

9.2 Specifically, the Claimant seeks:
   [Set out the relief sought, e.g.:]
   - A lump sum payment of £[AMOUNT]; and/or
   - Periodical payments of £[AMOUNT] per [month/year]; and/or
   - Transfer of [property/asset]; and/or
   - Such other provision as the Court thinks fit

### 10. Pre-Action Protocol

10.1 The Claimant has complied with the Pre-Action Protocol for the Resolution of Probate and
Inheritance Disputes by [sending letter of claim on [DATE] / mediation on [DATE] / etc.].

### AND the Claimant claims:

1. An order pursuant to section 2 of the Inheritance (Provision for Family and Dependants) Act
   1975 that reasonable financial provision be made for the Claimant out of the net estate of
   the Deceased;

2. [Specific relief as set out in paragraph 9.2 above];

3. Interest pursuant to section 35A of the Senior Courts Act 1981 [or section 69 of the County
   Courts Act 1984];

4. Costs;

5. Such further or other relief as the Court thinks fit.

---

## STATEMENT OF TRUTH

I believe that the facts stated in these Particulars of Claim are true. I understand that
proceedings for contempt of court may be brought against anyone who makes, or causes to be made,
a false statement in a document verified by a statement of truth without an honest belief in its
truth.

**Signed**: ........................

**[Name of Claimant / Litigation friend]**

**Dated**: [DATE]

---

## Notes for Completion

1. **Time Limits**: Applications must normally be made within 6 months of grant of representation
2. **Service**: Serve on all persons with an interest in the estate
3. **Evidence**: Consider what witness statements and documentary evidence will be needed
4. **Valuation**: Obtain professional valuations where necessary
5. **Settlement**: Consider mediation and settlement throughout
